revised_title: The Effect of Pulmonary Ventilation on Oxygen in Venous Blood
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to understand the effect of shallow and deep breathing on oxygen saturation in the blood. They found that shallow breathing resulted in lower oxygen saturation, while deep breathing led to higher oxygen saturation. The study suggests that proper breathing techniques can help improve oxygen supply to the body and prevent health issues like pneumonia and phthisis.
